job_title: Head Office Receptionist in Bristol, England
pros: There's Ongoing training, lots of support and flexibility for people who have priorities at home or other priorities that they may need to tend to outside of work.
cons: Recruitment process is long and can be difficult at some stages. It begins with a 45 minute questionnaire to see what kind of personality you have. If you are successful at this stage, you are then called in for a psychiatric test. If you pass this stage, you are then called in for a face-to-face interview.

pros: Love to meet the clients and to help them achieve independence
cons: Since the change on April 8th there are too many office members messages are not getting through to the correct people it is like working with organised chaos a lot of staff members are very unhappy if I was looking for another job I would not choose brunelcare with the management as it is

pros: Training good, pay good, team work good.
cons: Manager, disrespectful, unapproachable, rude, patronising and flippant

pros: Great team to work for. Supportive and helpful team members and leaders. Great rate of pay. Reasonable working hours. Great client base.
cons: Poor accessibility outside of work  to the online system for absence and holiday planning.

pros: They are paying for holiday, good wages, mileage payed, friendly colleagues
